page.title: 11RELIGION IN HEADON
page.content: The Church in Headon was built in 1250. it is biult of some sort of limestone which was probably quarried in Lincolnshire. It has 1 bell (it used to have 2, but one cracked). The bell still works and it was cast in Loughborough. The church does not have a choir and the vicar is also vicar of 5 other churches. At an average service there are 5 people who attend. There is one service a week. The usual collection goes to the church but at Harvest Festivals it goes to the Cheshire Home in East Retford. The church itself has a crack in its tower and they need money which they find is hard to get. Headon gets a grant from the Government but they find that this is not enough to mend the church. Some money has been raised from the well dressing in the past 5 years. The church has its own church hall.
